intro: Cheiranthus alpinus, commonly known as the alpine honesty, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and produces small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils at high altitudes. Cheiranthus alpinus is known for its hardy nature and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
